Rule: Higher education levels (Masters and Doctorate) are positively correlated with earning more than $50k a year.
Variability in hours worked among those earning more than $50k, with both high and low extremes being possible (13, 40, 63 hours).
Combination of higher education (Masters or Doctorate) with varying work hours (13, 40, or 63) can lead to earning more than $50k a year, even if other factors remain constant.
